DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure ANC Greater than or Equal to 500/uL Negation Due To Disease Involvement Or Infection Outcome Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether the ANC count greater than 500 u/L was not due to disease involvement or infection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Absolute Neutrophil Count Greater than or Equal to 500/mm3 Negation Due To Disease or Disorder Involvement Or Infection Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A quantitative microscopic finding indicating that neutrophils are found at greater than or 500 per cubic millimeter field in a sample._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Caused by or resulting from._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Absolute Neutrophil Count Greater than or Equal to 500/mm3 Negation Due To Disease or Disorder Involvement Or Infection Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative microscopic finding indicating that neutrophils are found at greater than or 500 per cubic millimeter field in a sample._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Caused by or resulting from._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce._The result of an action.

Concepts.longName: Absolute Neutrophil Count Greater than or Equal to 500/mm3
Concepts.definition: A quantitative microscopic finding indicating that neutrophils are found at greater than or 500 per cubic millimeter field in a sample.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the ANC count greater than 500 u/L not due to disease involvement or infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If no, was the failure to recover ANC greater than or equal to 500/uL due to persistent leukemia involvement or infection?
